text:
I was reading the Julia source code and stumbled upon the functions `LinearAlgebra.copyto!`  and `LinearAlgebra.copy_transpose!`  defined in `LinearAlgebra/src/matmul.jl` <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/master/stdlib/LinearAlgebra/src/matmul.jl#L681|function copyto!>
The definition seems to chase its own tail
Can someone explain this code?

elements.text: I was reading the Julia source code and stumbled upon the functions

The definition seems to chase its own tail
Can someone explain this code?

text: the key is that some of the arguments are different. There are other methods of these functions defined somewhere (`blas.jl` maybe?) that will get called after 1 iteration through. It appears the purpose of this code is to unwrap transposes and conjugations although I'll admit it's fairly inscrutable
